title: Is it normal to listen to really loud music and not get hearing issues? I can listen to music as loud as possible with headphones and not get any damage, but I can hear very well. - Quora

response.answer_text: The damage just doesn't happen. You don't just sit there and *ping* you can't hear. The biggest sign is if you hear a high pitched ringing in your ears. That means you have damaged them and you shouldn't push any more luck. Remember it's irreversible. Once it's gone it's gone. I've seen plenty of guys who worked in loud sites and warehouses and they can't hear shit. All because they didn't wear protective gear.

What?  You may be fine now but wait a while. In the 70’s I used to go to a lot of pop concerts and my ears would be ringing for about three days afterwards, Yes, Wishbone Ash, Focus and so on. No I am lucky I am not deaf or impaired so far. Wise up, one day you are going to be old and if your hearing is screwed so are you. Take care.
